name: Renaissance New York Hotel 57

reviews.text: I stayed by Renaissance 57 many times, and in this neighborhood is the one I prefer: the style is unique, staff is really friendly and helpful when problems arise, and is the perfect location to start visiting Manhattan, near the main undergrounds and 5 mins walk from Central Park.
reviews.title: Stylish, central, beautiful hotel in NYC

reviews.text: Rooms are not big compared to other hotels in the neighborhood (Fitz, Loews, Parker Meridian), but I find them warm and complete. Gym is OK, and the lounge bar named Opia is stylish and wellknown by New Yorkers. Breakfast buffet is tiny but complete.
reviews.title: Worked great for us!

reviews.text: We booked two rooms here for a night in the City. Rooms were great. Sleek, comfortable, small, but plenty all that was needed. Loved the lobbies and the general design of the hotel. Location can't be beat either. Best of all, the staff was super nice, pleasant, and always ready to be helpful (although we actually didn't ask for much, it seemed that way...)
reviews.title: Fab hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here a few years back it is in a Fab location in NY the hotel was clean staff friendly when leaving the front desk ordered a limo there is a fab little Diner just along from the hotel brill breakfast
reviews.title: Interesting- Mixed Feelings about this one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a boutique type hotel but it still carries the Renaissance brand. Room was small and had some clear cigarette burn marks on the wood surface next to the window and on bedside table.... not what I would have expected in a hotel of this caliber. Overall room needs a good do-over (paint, varnish and some scrubbing). Location cannot be beat and even with issues is still better than many other NYC properties. Price was right compared to other hotels in vicinity but still feel this place needs a good clean and renovation.
reviews.title: Chic little hotel in NYC

reviews.text: Good Boutique Hotel, definitely have stayed in much better Renaissance. Stayed on a junior suite and was good size, nothing too fancy, more like a Marriott than a Renaissance. The lobby is much more boutique than the rooms!
reviews.title: Good but not Great!

reviews.text: Great Shower Heads! thats a big plus for me! the concierge lounge was pretty good for breakfast!
reviews.title: perfect location

reviews.text: Very friendly staff! good hotel to stay if you get a good deal, if not there are better places to stay in the city!
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Average Service

reviews.text: perfect hotel for business. located one block from the express subway. rooms are spacious for new york and designed with ample desk and closet space. bathroom is sleek and modern. nice bar and restaurant. new favorite boutique hotel in NY.
reviews.title: Trendy but TINY boutique hotel; great staff!

reviews.text: Location, location, location. Close to everything, subway one block away. Reasonable rooms (quite dated, yet confortable), but average service. A bit on the slow and careless side. Better hotels for the same price in NYC.
reviews.title: Tarnish on the charm

reviews.text: I stayed here for a weekend with a couple friends,the rooms are definitely small but they are clean and the bathrooms are really nice,they also provide Aveda products! The staff was very attentive(not sure if this was because my friend is a Marriot Platinum member) and the lounge and restaurant was really good,we got a seafood and burger dish that was pretty decent. The location of this hotel is great,near great shopping and restaurants I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Small rooms but great service/staff!

reviews.text: We were in town for pleasure and busy each day from the opening bell. So the room size 'argument' is moot (people, it's New York City, get out of your rooms!!). The 57 is a solid location for all things NYC and the staff is great, so on these alone we'd stay again. However, some of the rooms are looking a little rough and in need of better maintenance and upkeep. All-in-all, good value!
reviews.title: Good location, but a little worn-down...
Below average. Will try elsewhere next trip.
reviews.text: Tiny but clean rooms, good location for business visitors, staff not that helpful. Sure there are better options at the same price. The noisest and most ineffective a/c I have encountered in the US.

No help getting cabs or with bags. When we checked in one of our three reservations was lost. The front desk did not seem to understand we still needed a third room and as it was 1am we would either pay or sort it out in the morning. Checking in took ages. Front desk staff trying to be helpful and polite but just not resolving the small problem. After getting to the room the reservation was suddenly found and we had to move to another (thankfully better) room, so hit the sack close to 1.30am.
reviews.title: Small Room, But Nice Hotel
Loved It!
reviews.text: Will try somewhere else next time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the mixed reviews here, I was slightly nervous about booking, but I was only staying one night, so I did it. I'm glad I did. Stayed over Sunday night and enjoyed it overall. Would stay here if rate is sub $200.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Surprise in Midtown East

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: A quiet pseudo boutique hotel

reviews.text: --while many reviewers complained about the room size, I found my Superior King quite adequate. I had booked the cheapest "cozy" room and was upgraded for being a Platinum member.
reviews.title: The Best NYC Hotel That You Don't Know Anything About

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: --definitely not your standard Renaissance but a smaller boutique feel like Kimpton's. Adult-oriented. No children seen.
reviews.title: Perfect NYC Hotel Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: --clean, compact, modern, and functional room furnishings. Large TV with HD programming,
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really appreciate the location of Renaissance 57 – Lexington avenue which is close to everything, Bloomberg office and Bloomingdales are just around the corner. Opia restaurant (lobby level) serves perfect breakfasts – omelet is a piece of art.
reviews.title: Bloomingdales and opia omelet – all incl

reviews.text: Generally the hotel is ok. It is not as outdated as many other hotels of that category. However it really depends on the room you stay in. Our first choice was a classic double – really small, very old and with such a noisy air conditioner that it was literally impossible to sleep. The next morning we’ve got an upgrade to superior which was nice (photo attached), although aircon still not the quietest one.
reviews.title: Best boutique hotel around

reviews.text: Our story with the hotel was the laundry case. We wanted 3 polos to be cleaned the next morning, however something went wrong, and on our leaving day they were still not done. The receptionist was very nice taking care of everything and the hotel mailed us the cleaned clothes free of charge to Miami. It was a pity though that after the laundry all 3 polos were ruined (small twice the size). Be careful with that.
reviews.title: Interesting.....

reviews.text: All and all, middle impression of the stay. Would consider coming back because of the location, but will be choosing the room carefully.
reviews.title: extra luggage from other guests seems to be a pattern

reviews.text: Now, taking into consideration this hotel calls itself a boutique hotel (small rooms, few amenities) it's probably one of the best in it's type I've ever stayed in. The rooms are small but have every amenity you need (minus bathroom hooks). They are styled perfectly and very clean. Surprisingly, lots of storage space and a very elegant bathroom. The staff was superb!!!! Everyone from the bellhops to the waiters in the quaint bar to the conceriege, made it a point to say hello and ask if they could be of any assistance. Easy to check-in and the valet parking was very efficient.
reviews.title: Trying too hard to be hip. Just try to be good.

reviews.text: I've stayed hear on several occassions on business and very much like the location on 57th and Lexington. Only a couple blocks to Central Park and was able to go jogging there every morning. Rooms are not huge, but very modern with huge TVs. The lobby bar is always busy and has a nice (but small) patio overlooking the intersection. Rates are a pretty good margain for NYC in the summer, but very expensive in the fall. Depending on the time of year ago, it's a great hotel!
reviews.title: Great style, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing how the space is used, and we enjoyed our stay very much. Staff was friendly and supportive.
reviews.title: Great designed up to date rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just got back from a weekend in NYC. I've stayed at the Renaissance in Times Square in the past and decided to give Hotel 57 a try. Check-in is on the 2nd floor which is not unusual for NYC. The front desk staff were super friendly and helpful. There was only one person checking people in and there were a couple of people in front of us. We were greeted by another staffer helping people in the lounge and given a couple of cold bottles of water as soon as we got on line. When I got to the desk, we were told our room was not available yet and that she would call me as soon as it was ready. It was around 12:30 in the afternoon and think check-in time is around 3:00 and even though I requested early check-in, understood perfectly. I had booked a larger corner room with my Marriott points and asked if we could be upgraded to a terrace room. She said she would check to see if it was available. Lucky us, it was and we were upgraded to a corner room with a terrace. The room was not large but a great size and very functional. It had a sitting area with sofa and chair, work desk to the side and a very big flat screen tv. The king bed was very comfortable - linens were of great quality. The bathroom had double vanity and large shower - and it was very clean and shower water pressure was good. The closet was a great size which doubled as a changing area. I loved the terrace.
reviews.title: Wonderful Staff

reviews.text: The staff was terrific. We were greeted by everyone as we were coming and going. The maid must have forgotten to put wash cloths in the room and I called the front desk for them at 10:30 p.m. It was delivered within 10 minutes. The room was very clean and of nice quality.
reviews.title: A bit better than last time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again when I visit NYC again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and top notch staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let's clear up a few things about most every hotel in Manhattan: yes, the rooms are small; yes, there is road noise almost 24/7; yes, the parking and amenities can be expensive. That being said, it's all in how the hotel handles all of the other aspects, in my opinion, that make or break one's experience at the property. I stayed at Hotel 57 using Marriott Rewards points for my boyfriend's birthday weekend. Not only did a call ahead to the concierge ensure a special birthday basket of chocolates and a card, the manager had wine and bottles of water (complimentary and on ice) sent up to the room in anticipation of our arrival. If you have any special requests or needs, Joe, their main concierge, is your guy. The check-in staff was friendly and knowledgeable. They were able to give me a room upgrade to a corner room on the 16th floor with a king-size bed. The room was awesomely modern, with a very comfortable bed, and the room had 4 windows (including a frosted one in the bathroom). The bathroom was so cool. I loved the frosted strip around the top of the walls to let more light into the room, and the toilet was off-set from the sink/tub. The bathroom was all marble and had great lighting. The tub/shower was nice and there was adequate shower pressure. We didn't hear any noise at all from the other rooms. We didn't have a chance to visit the restaurant on-site, Opia, but it seemed to be a fun spot with a nice bar. Sure, our room wasn't the biggest room ever, but it was clean, tasteful, elegant, and very suitable for showering and sleeping. We loved this property and would return!
reviews.title: Great staff, great location, great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed here for a couple of nights while visiting friends in NYC. We had the "cozy" room (which is really code for teeny room!), but we didn't mind the small size, as we were barely in the room anyways. We did joke that it reminded us of an upscale college dorm room. The room was clean and well-appointed, and looked as though it had been recently remodeled. The bed was comfortable and the shower had good water pressure.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but wouldn't recommend for light sleepers!

reviews.text: We interacted with several staff members and they were all friendly and helpful. The concierge recommended a good deli nearby for us to grab a bite to eat after we arrived, and they even allowed us to check out late on the day we departed.
reviews.title: Small, comfortable hotel

reviews.text: My only real complaint about this hotel has to do with how bothersome the street noise was at night. I had a hard time going to sleep--our room was right on Lexington and even though we didn't get back to the hotel until after 1am on both nights, it was still difficult for me to fall asleep with all the traffic noise. If you're a heavy sleeper, you likely won't have this problem, but I didn't get much rest on either night. Maybe it would have been better if we'd requested a room on a higher floor (we were on the sixth) or if we'd asked for a room facing another street.
reviews.title: rather nice hotel at 57th and Lexington

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed here about four times as I find the location very convenient, the staff is very attentive and friendly, and the rooms are very comfy and well-appointed. They are generally very small, but I don't find this to be a problem. The restaurant is fairly good and the room service is fine too. The breakfast buffet is very nice. I like this hotel a lot!
reviews.title: Absolutely Brutal

reviews.text: We stayed for three nights and found the room and beds comfortable.
reviews.title: Good value, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was great as you felt you left the crowded Manhattan streets behind you.
reviews.title: A nice hotel, but nothing extra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's surrounded by good family friendly restaurants, shops, a handy drug store and the beautiful Sutton Place area.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: But the real star is Joey the concierge, who did his utmost to make our trip as enjoyable as possible, from maps to printing off boarding passes.
reviews.title: Disappointing hotel but great location and helpful staff.....

reviews.text: We stayed here one night on a short layover visit to NYC in the end of August. Good things: great air conditioning, comfy bed, nice TV, very nice bathroom and shower, plenty of room to stow baggage and stuff even though the room is small. With no breakfast or really any other services besides checking you in and out, the hotel is just a really nice place to sleep. And it is really nice, with a good aesthetic.
reviews.title: Great location. Awesome rooftop view of Chrysler Building at night!

reviews.text: Location: Perfect. A minute from Bloomingdales, 5 minutes from Central Park.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: Hotel: Nice, somewhat quiet.
reviews.title: Superb Service and Caring People

reviews.text: Rooms: Small, a bit outdated, but clean. Good storage and a small desk. The bed was luxuriously comfortable. The bathroom is quite nice and clean.
reviews.title: Location good for Central Park, Great bathrooms!

reviews.text: Staff: Extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Great location. Good staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really enjoyed this hotel.
reviews.title: Was pleasantly surprised!

reviews.text: When a bad storm hit New York and delayed my return home, I was desperate for a hotel. Travel agent couldn't find anything in the computers and started calling hotels, landing me a night here. At this point, anything that was clean and quiet within an hour of La Guardia would have been fine, but I was very impressed with this hotel. Having stayed in Manhatten in a number of other hotels that were mediocre at best, this now rises to the top of my list for my return.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel when I would have settled for far less

reviews.text: The hotel is modern. Unlike a lot of hotels that spend money only on the lobby, this one is modern and well maintained throughout, including the rooms. The rooms are small, but what is different about the Renaissance Hotel 57 is that the rooms are very well laid out to be extremely functional such that you don't really mind the small quarters. The restaurant at the bottom was very busy, so although I didn't try it, it looked like a good place to eat dinner.
reviews.title: Great first time at the Renaissance 57

reviews.text: Location is excellent. You can get to Central Park and many other locations nearby.
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been staying in NYC for over 20 years at least twice a year. I traveled with my friend this week who is also a frequent visitor. We stay in Marriott brand hotels almost exclusively. We frequently stay at the Renaissance Times Square. Comparing the two Renaissance properties I would say I really like the location of the 57. Lexington and E 57th has a lot going on around it without the tourist bustle of Times Square, The 57 is also much less expensive than the Times Square location. That being said, the rooms are far smaller at the 57. We were both traveling with our 16 year old sons. It was a little cramped. However, for two women it would have been fine. The hotel is very clean, chic decor and the staff was helpful and professional. My companion travels for business frequently and has accrued a high status in the Marriott Reward club, hence we enjoyed a complimentary breakfast buffet consisting of cereal, yogurt, fruit, bagels, toast, scrambled eggs, warm oatmeal, juice and coffee. The buffet was served in a comfortable private lounge with television. We were also treated to one appetizer off of the menu after 5:00pm the evening before. If you are not a Marriott member there is a nice restaurant across the lobby, Opia, that you could visit.
reviews.title: A very good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in Hotel 57 for Christmas with my husband. It was a great stay. Rooms are small, as expected in New York, but very modern and comfortable. The lounge serves nice cocktails which are great after a day of walking around the city. The staff was friendly and had no problem letting us keep our luggage there after check out so we could enjoy the rest of our last day there. It's not smack in the middle of Times Square so it has a calmer vibe which is nice at the end of the day. Still, you're in Midtown so there's always something going on nearby. I have stayed in many hotels in Manhattan, big and small, but I truly enjoyed my stay at Hotel 57 and will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Top location, style and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a cozy but lively hotel in NYC. We enjoyed the energy and decor, food and entertainment. Our room was amazingly quiet - no street noise though lots of traffic, and no neighbor noise. Good location for walking about.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: Staff is very welcoming and accommodating. Great bar on site and the rooms are very clean and quaint. The bed was super comfy with over sized pillows and a down comforter. Great location in a nice part of the city, lots of juice bars near by too
reviews.title: Great Choice for NYC Trip

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Renaissance NY 57. We choose the hotel for the location and the fact that we usually always are pleased with the Renaissance brand. Sadly, this hotel fell short for me in all regards except for the location...that I will say is excellent. It is located close to midtown, Central Park and all the shopping you could hope for. However, the rest of the stay was disappointing. When we arrived at 9pm there was no bellman anywhere. We had driven into the city and needed to valet park. I had to go into the hotel while my husband waited in the car and find someone who could help with parking. I certainly expect that a hotel that charges the prices they do and says they are a 4 star hotel would at least have a bellman. (especially in NYC). This happened both nights we were there. I will say I did see a doorman/bellman there during the day on occasion, but why would there not be anyone at night? The room itself was small, but that's expected in NYC. We had a superior room so it was larger than the regular rooms and it was still small. The decor is tired and dated, definitely could use a remodel. The best part of the room was the bathroom...fairly spacious and nice. Next time, I'll go back down to the East Side Marriott...only a few blocks away, much bigger rooms and a bellman!
reviews.title: Needs some work.

reviews.text: We really enjoy our stay in this hotel. The service was excellent, room was small but very comfortable. Very nice bedding and towels. The room was attractive. We would stay there again. We came with two other couples and we all agreed that we loved this hotel.
reviews.title: Great location to enjoy New York City
Nice and different
reviews.text: Yes, the rooms are rather small, but they're pretty average for New York. Still, nicely appointed, comfortable bed, spacious bathrooms. Staff is very attentive and friendly. Location is great. And, the vibe is super. Recommend this place.

If you want a great place to stay in NYC without the craziness of Times Square, the Renaissance New York Hotel 57 is perfect. You are only a few easy walking blocks to Central Park, Columbus Circle and great shopping along 57th Street and Restaurants in the area too - we went to Fig & Olives and JoJos - both only about a 10 minute walk - and Harry Cipriani, near Central Park for great bellinis! The staff was helpful - our room wasn't ready when we checked in and upon request, they called us when it was ready so we could come back and check in - the room was adequate - what you would expect from a boutique hotel in NYC; a little small, but comfortable and clean. I am definitely staying here again the next time I'm in the city for work or pleasure.
reviews.title: Excellent location in NYC; near Central Park and great Restaurants/Shopping

reviews.text: I had the smallest room imaginable in this hotel. I’ve been traveling forbusiness over 15 years and I have never seen a room so small and this was with an upgrade ad Marriott Gold member. The exercise room was a joke the concierge lounge food was a cold Pizza and some crackers, the hotel was unwelcoming as possible, I cannot recommend staying at this Hotel
reviews.title: This is not good hotel

reviews.text: I've stayed at the Hotel 57 a number of times and feel able to make some pretty balanced statements about it.
reviews.title: Could be wonderful - unfortunately pretty average!

reviews.text: You're experience will (obviously) be directly impacted by the other events going on within the hotel while you're there.
reviews.title: Uniquely Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For example - on one stay you would have thought that I was the only person in the hotel(!), whereas my most recent visit I struggled to find a seat in the bar....
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Great City - Nice Area

description: This recently renovated, Manhattan boutique hotel has unveiled a completed couture masterpiece by award-winning designer Jordan Mozer.
